['Monarchy - A system in which a monarch (king or queen) serves as the head of state, usually inheriting the position through family ties.', 'Dictatorship - A form of government where one person has complete control and power over the country, usually through force or fear.', 'Democracy - A system in which power is held by the people, either directly or through elected representatives.', 'Oligarchy - A system in which power is held by a small group of individuals, often wealthy elites.', 'Theocracy - A system in which religious leaders hold political power and make decisions based on religious doctrine.', 'Totalitarianism - A form of government where the ruler has complete control over every aspect of society and the lives of its citizens.', 'Federalism - A system in which power is divided between a central government and smaller regional governments.', 'Confederation - A loose association of states or provinces under a central government, often formed for political or economic reasons.', 'Constitutional monarchy - A system in which a monarch serves as head of state but their powers are limited by a constitution or legal framework.', 'Parliamentary democracy - A system in which the prime minister and cabinet are elected by the legislature, and the head of state is usually a symbolic figurehead.']
